p: In Fig 4(b) we focus on epidemic pairs with R 0 < 7. In this plot, there are a large number of points with epidemic size FI ∞ ≈ 0. Upon closer examination, these points turn out to have R 0 < 1, as expected. We note that R 0 = 1 implies β = 0.33 × 10 −4 person −1 day −1, which corresponds to the point in Fig 4(b) where the epidemic size starts to rise above 0. In all further plots, we focus on the ( E, V) pairs where 1 < R 0 < 7 and m > 1, leading to the analysis of 956 epidemic pairs.
